DPrnjKS1D5ZGGNYwnHO0bg.text: I ordered crust pizza delivery on a Friday night, as I was stuck at home with a swollen leg and pretty much immobile. I ordered a Meat Deluxe pizza and the grilled char siew wings.This is one of those rare instances where the food looks better than it tastes. The pizza certainly gourmet and hand formed, topped with real food like chicken, ham and sausage. However, it was remarkably dry and flat. I tasted a sweet base, probably from the barbecue sauce and then a whole lot of dry indistinguishable meat in my mouth. No punchy cheeses or seasoning and yes, I did add chili flakes as a backup and even that wasn't spicy. The barbecued wings fared better and were rather novel. Nicely charred and not oily at all.I normally eat pizzas at La Nonna and Pepp Pizza, which have the same price point and "fresh ingredients only" marketing angle. I'd say those two joints serve way better pizzas. I would argue that maybe my pizza wasn't as great because it was delivery, but I've had Pepp pizza delivered and it still tasted great. Maybe the Crust boxes have some dehydrating agent embedded... I don't know. Another thing I considered was that this was Australian style pizza. I haven't the slightest idea what that means but I sure hope they get tastier, juicier pies than this down under or they are missing out big time.Nonetheless, if you're hungry and you like real ingredients on your plate and don't want the minimum spend required for Pepp delivery, Crust is the next best thing I supposed. Would eat there if I had choice and flexibility but it does the job when you've got the munchies.

K0GPKrQvch6RMMJnFCahig.text: The pint of Guinness tastes like carbonated waterThe pint of pure blonde tastes like carbonated waterThe gin & tonic is 98% tonicDo not buy drinks here. They are obscenely watered down.

krL9kfAzi_KDCpd2sHY1ig.text: We ordered two pizzas and a salad. Everything was terrible.-The delivery took about an hour.-Our food was put in a tied plastic bag, which means the crusts were soggy when it arrived.-Despite the crust being soggy, the pizza was dry. There was virtually no sauce on it and the toppings were dried out.-We ordered two 13"x8" pizzas. Or at least we thought we did. The BOX has those dimensions, the pizzas were much smaller.-The salad was way too small. They said it feeds two. it doesn't.Everything cost me $72. I spent $72 on JUNK. Don't eat here. It's a rip off.

vzxcIV561khZooeyO-dE3Q.text: I had a pick up order. My pizza was ready in time and still warm when I arrived. The regular size pizza is small and not enough for 2pax. Toppings (gourmet cheese) were good but nothing special about the crust or sauce. I have eaten better and bigger pizza at this price range.

D5sti4uFgeoqKQ9n88N4bA.text: Friends had been raving about Crust for a while so we thought we'd check it out over a long weekend.The boys really liked the bright red char siew chicken wings with sweet chilli sauce. We ordered two pizzas to share, one much lauded roast duck pizza as well as the spicy pesto scallops pizza.The pizzas looked better than they tasted ... the former was a bit too sweet because of the hoisin sauce and the latter whilst interesting was just OK. Service when we got there was pretty rubbish, the silly boy claiming someone had reserved the tables when it was available. Thankfully this was quickly remedied by the proprietor.

photos.caption: Photo of Crust Gourmet Pizza Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Roast duck pizza and spicy pesto scallop pizza
Photo of Crust Gourmet Pizza Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Char siew chicken wings

O0miOnEWGeEv3h7q8QgeRw.text: Do I want pizza tonight? The only choice is always Crust! They do deliver in select areas but highly recommend eating it freshly made at their resto. We typically do half of sausage duo and half gourmet cheese for a healthier option. I recommend sticking to their pizza thou. Not a big fan of their chicken wings as it lacks flavor to me

8Lp0w2Yi5aE9rn3midu8MQ.text: Only pizza place that I've been in Singapore that actually puts gourmet toppings, generously! Enjoyed my beer to at 1 for 1 from 5pm to 8pm. Try the Moroccan Lamb, Vegetarian, Peri-Peri Chicken and Wagyu Prawn.

photos.caption: Photo of Crust Gourmet Pizza Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Shop Front

rIHTDq028Qa_5d3fXN1GRg.text: I am a fan of Crust. The ingredients are fresh, and I like the flavors. Noteworthy is the truffle mushroom with asparagus. Not too much of a truffle taste that it masks the taste of the whole pizza, and the baked asparagus gives it a crunch. The crust is a tad sweet too, so it somehow goes with the balsamic dressing to create a well-balanced taste. In general, the food is pretty good and relatively healthy!

IY_91tMkWuC792NNiab54Q.text: Ordered crust pizza last night.  2 gluten free pizzas for $51!!!   Complete ripoff.  Pizzas were small, average in taste, and Luke warm.   Was still extremely hungry after  finishing and couldn't get over paying $51 for hardly any pizza.   Won't be ordering from them ever again.  I've had pizza all over the world and all over Singapore and definitely towards the lower end in terms of quality and value.  Ordered a 4 cheese pizza and only tasted Gorgonzola once as they didn't put much any of the toppings on.
